meanings.definition: Wavering between different opinions or actions.
meanings.sent1: Her vacillation nature made it hard for her to make up her mind.
meanings.sent2: The vacillation student couldn't decide which elective to choose.
meanings.sent3: His vacillation behavior at the ice cream shop was comical.
meanings.sent4: The vacillation flame of the candle danced in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The vacillation leaves on the tree seemed unsure which way to fall.

meanings.sent1: The vacillation in his voice revealed his uncertainty.
meanings.sent2: Her vacillation in making decisions often led to missed opportunities.
meanings.sent3: The cat's vacillation in choosing between two toys was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The vacillation of the pendulum symbolized the uncertainty of time.
meanings.sent5: The vacillation of the weather made planning a picnic difficult.

meanings.sent1: The vacillation of the stock market kept investors on edge.
meanings.sent2: The vacillation of the waves made swimming challenging.
meanings.sent3: The vacillation of the car's engine sounded like a symphony of uncertainty.
meanings.sent4: The vacillation of emotions in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The vacillation of the wind caused the trees to sway back and forth.
